on tuesday i stopped by a bar with a friend for a quick drink but unfortunately the experience was marred by subpar service and an unimpressive drink i ordered a long island iced tea a common cocktail but the bartenders had to search for the recipe online and even then they missed some key ingredients despite this they still served the drink which was awful the service was slow and when we were ready to pay and leave the waitress was nowhere to be found chatting with her friends instead

the variety of seafood offered at this establishment is truly remarkable and the price is unbeatable for around 20 per person you can indulge in a wide range of delicacies from sushi and sashimi to mussels and crab legs the selection is vast and the quality is consistently high however be aware that arriving late may limit your options and some items may not be as fresh additionally the crab legs are highly popular so act quickly to secure your share while the sushi is delicious its best to avoid it past 9 pm as it may become dried out nevertheless the dining experience is enjoyable and the staff is friendly and helpful

lingerie that i can order from my room at all hoursamazing so love jones is way overpriced but they have some very unique and erotic items that will make you drool as you walk by the window displays which changehourly i believe nim a total sucker for window displays and on this particular trip i was struck by the gorgeous beach bunny bathing suit display nhttpswwwbeachbunnyswimwearcomindexcfmnthese bathing suits are as close as you can get to wearing lingerie during the dayand they are fabulous because love jones carries them makes them aok in my booknthe gold star pasties were a huge hit i bought them for my girlfriends bday to go under her hot pink dress and lets just say we saw a lot of those pasties all nightnif you have won in the casino or have a boy who has moneygo here and have a blast trying onbuying lingerie you can really only find in places like las vegas

i would not recommend findlay vw to anyone i bought a brand new 2011 vw jetta from them last november and just two weeks later i had a blown tire the dealership was unwilling to help me resolve the issue and the salesperson i worked with didnt return my calls after a lot of backandforth they finally agreed to split the cost of the tire with me now im having another problem with the car and i wont be taking it back to findlay vw for any reason instead ill go to desert volkswagen where the customer service is much better overall my experience with findlay vw was horrible and i wouldnt recommend them to anyone

the consigned furniture was intriguing and reasonably priced but it made up a disproportionate 10 of the inventory which is uncommon for a consignment store the rest of the furniture can be found at any other store on spring mountain but its overpriced here i wont be returning

the breakfast they served us hit the spot like we hadnt expected it is possible that their biscuits are the best ive ever had or can ever hope to have my friend had blueberry pancakes that were so fresh the berries were falling out i had an omelette made with country sausage the omelette was very big and fluffy and yellow just the way eggs should be i was afraid of having to wait long because of the other yelp reviews but we were eating less than 15 minutes after we arrived if youre in south mountain and want to eat breakfast for around 10person in a place which feels like it could be on a beautiful little farm in the midwest come here its very lovely and a great way to start the morning on your weekends off from work with those you love
my vegas trip was filled with delicious meals but one dining experience stood out from the rest as the best food i ate during my fiveday stay

we had no choice but to switch to cox because of the direction our apartment faces but the service has been abysmal the hd channels we pay extra for are fuzzy and jumpy and despite a technicians attempts to fix the issues they returned were exhausted and want to cancel our contract as soon as possible

when my friend and i came in on a monday night we were really worried this place was empty thats not a good sign then as we sat down i looked at reviews on here and i was doubly worried nnyou guys this place is awesome our waiter earnest was a super nice guy and even though the restaurant was empty he didnt hover over us or try to make a lot of small talk with us i realize wait staff gets bored on slow nights but i just dont like making conversation with people i dont know when im sitting there starving to death so in my mind he was freakin awesomenni could see how the two menu thing could be confusing but honestly you get like 10 menus at chilis so who cares its a second menu with like 5 things on it for an appetizer i got crab rangoon and they did it like chips and dip which in retrospect i have to wonder why i havent been eating crab rangoon like this my whole life nnthe food was excellent i got kalbi and my friend got bulgogi the menu said the kalbi was made la style so i didnt start throwing chairs in a rage when it wasnt made just like korean kalbi nni really recommend you give this place a shot especially during the week because it looks like they need it there the most the reason i gave this place 4 stars was because for my kalbi they gave me scissors and tongs to cut it off the bone and although my motor skills are sometimes questionable im pretty sure i could correctly operate a sharp knife to help me with the task of cutting the meat off the bone it just got a little awkward after a bit was all of course now as i write this i realize i could have just asked for a knife but i feel like that would have been too easy

i started going to arrichion last fall before they began offering livingsocialgroupon deals and i thoroughly enjoyed it the heat the instructors the sense of community  everything was great however once the crowds arrived the experience took a turn for the worse arrichion has since become overcrowded and ive had to wait outside for 30 minutes or get turned away from classes online signups would be a helpful solution and the lack of instruction in the yoga room is disappointing despite the sweaty and sore workouts the monthly fees are now too expensive for the value provided

i recently visited this salon and had a great experience with calvin who gave me a haircut that exceeded my expectations especially considering my hair growth after chemotherapy he took the time to discuss my desired style without rushing and his expertise was evident in the final result i highly recommend calvin and will be returning in 46 weeks for my next trim

im a huge fan of lingerie and im always on the lookout for unique and erotic pieces that are available at all hours while love jones may be a bit pricey their selection is truly impressive and their window displays are absolutely stunning changing hourly im particularly fond of their beach bunny bathing suits which are essentially lingerie for the daytime theyre a musthave for anyone looking to make a statement and let me tell you the gold star pasties were a huge hit at my girlfriends birthday party  we saw a lot of them throughout the night if youre looking to treat yourself or your significant other love jones is definitely worth a visit

we had to switch to cox from directtv because of the direction our apartment faces but the service has been terrible the hd channels we pay extra for are fuzzy and jumpy and even though a technician came out and made some repairs the problems returned were fed up and want to cancel our contract as soon as possible

when my friend and i visited this restaurant on a monday night we were initially concerned by the lack of customers however our waiter earnest was very friendly and made sure we had everything we needed the food was also delicious with the crab

randomly came upon this place with some friends and we totally fell in love  great energy inside and the food rocks  we shared 3 tapas dishes and had cocktails and it was deliciouswe were just looking for a snack  loved having the basque influence there with the kalimotxo 18 was tough to shell out there for this but i hadnt had one in forever so i splurgedand it was exactly as i had hoped for  really cool restaurant am looking forward to going backi hope it sticks around because not many in this area have held up

on a busy friday night you enter four peaks and are immediately enveloped in the lively atmosphere of the weekend warmup the bar is packed with friendly faces and the music is loud and energetic while you usually enjoy trying different beers you always come back to your trusty friend kilt lifter its wellbalanced flavor pairs perfectly with a variety of dishes including spinach artichoke dip shrimp goat cheese bruschetta and their delicious calamari which is the best youve ever had

im absolutely thrilled with the haircut i received at this salon calvin did an amazing job especially considering ive been unhappy with my hair growth after chemotherapy he took the time to listen to my concerns and seemed to understand exactly what i wanted i highly recommend him and will definitely be going back in 46 weeks for a trim

the array of seafood they offer here for the price is truly impressive you can sample sushi and sashimi to mussels and crab legs they always feature salmon and sometimes even have crawfish theres a whole lot to pick from and usually the price is around 20 per person its hard to beat the value you get for your hardearned seafoodsnarfin dollar herenna couple of things i noticed in the few times ive done the buffet thing here if you arrive late the pickins will be slimmer there will be some items that you know have sat in the chafing dish that arent as palatablelooking as they were when first deployed you have to act fast when the batches of crab legs are put out since everyone and their mom seems to belly up for another round of these pronto i also steer clear of a lot of the sushi past 9 pm it always looks a little driedout and curious to me not something im willing to take too much of a chance onnnhowever i feel the dining experience here is pleasant the staff are friendly and helpful and there is a ton of good seafood to keep you satisfied there are even things that im a little unsure of how to eat like sea snails or something i couldnt quite recognize this place is densely frequented by the east valley asian community which to me says this is the place to find reasonablypriced good seafood beware thoughthe competition is fierce for those fresh batches of crab legs you may have to use your crab cracker to defend your rightlydeserved hardfoughtandwon portion

im puzzled by my persistent inclination to dine at this restaurant when im visiting the campus despite the fact that the sushi is merely passable and the prices are a bit steep the atmosphere doesnt exactly ooze sophistication either

without a doubt this is one of the top spots for live music in vegas the cosmo pool is the only place that comes close to rivaling it my husband and i practically live at the beach during the summer because they offer an amazing variety of concerts in a super relaxed and fun atmosphere its the perfect escape from the chaos of the strip weve seen some incredible performances from ziggy marley to one republic just be prepared for pricey drinks and long bar lines so its a good idea to grab some drinks beforehand

i visited a bar on tuesday with a friend hoping for a quick and enjoyable drink however my expectations were not met as the service was slow and the drinks were disappointing i ordered a long island iced tea but the bartenders seemed unfamiliar with the recipe and had to look it up online even then they failed to include some essential ingredients resulting in an unpleasant drink to make matters worse the waitress was slow to take our payment and seemed more interested in socializing with her friends than attending to our needs

im perplexed by my consistent desire to eat at this restaurant whenever im visiting the campus despite the fact that the sushi is merely adequate and the prices are steep the atmosphere doesnt exactly scream upscale dining experience either

we love dr pendleton i switched to her office when my daughter was younger and we were unhappy with healing hearts peds we have been a patient for over 5 years now always easy to get an appointment when needed and danielle  dr pendleton are wonderful with my kids

on our second visit to the smaller theatre we took in two shows the mousetrap and biloxi blues we had previously seen the mousetrap in london almost 40 years ago and it was time for a review we enjoyed the production in 2013 and as for biloxi blues neither of us had seen a production of neil simons autobiographical second part of the three

despite the lovely ambiance of this outdoor breakfast spot our service was unfortunately slow our party of two adults and four children ordered from the adult menu but our waitress took her time taking our order and we had to ask twice for a forgotten item after our meal we waited for our check but it took a bit longer than expected and when we finally received it we were told that the restaurant was experiencing computer issues despite the inconvenience i would still like to return to this quaint spot without the kids to try out their lunch and dinner options

i happened upon this place with some friends and we instantly fell in love with its lively atmosphere and fantastic food we shared a few tapas dishes and enjoyed some cocktails and everything was absolutely delicious it was a bit pricey but i hadnt had a kalimotxo in a long time so i decided to treat myself im really looking forward to going back and i hope this restaurant sticks around because there arent many places like it in the area

while exploring the area with some friends we randomly came across this amazing restaurant that completely won us over with its energetic vibe and mouthwatering cuisine we shared a few small plates and had some fantastic cocktails and let me tell you it was love at first bite the price tag was a bit steep but i hadnt indulged in a kalimotxo in ages so i figured why not im eagerly anticipating my next visit and hope this place stays put because its a true gem

the breakfast we were served was a delightful surprise with biscuits that were unexpectedly delicious my friends blueberry pancakes were fresh and bursting with flavor while my omelette made with country sausage was fluffy and yellow just as eggs should be despite some concerns about the wait time based on other yelp reviews we were able to enjoy our meal within 15 minutes of arriving if youre looking for a lovely breakfast spot in south mountain that feels like a charming farm in the midwest this is a great option for a weekend morning with loved ones

the food is mediocre and overpriced and the quality is not great ive been here before and didnt have a good experience but i came back with a friend who wanted to try it out i ordered the breakfast burritos which were tiny and disappointing the beans were not good especially the pinto beans i forget what the other side dish was but i think it was fries i love fries but sweet potato fries should be banned from restaurants unless theyre served in a different form

i decided to grab lunch at the 24th street spot that used to be olympic gyros the restaurant may not be large but the 499 gyro i ordered was certainly tasty and had plenty of meat unfortunately i was disappointed that they were unable to offer a cup of water to go with my meal which was a bit of a disappointment

i was having a relaxing pedicure until the technician made an error and cut one of my cuticles causing me to shout in discomfort the cuticle began bleeding profusely and the technician offered a hasty apology before moving on to the next nail despite the polish job looking fine the experience left me feeling uneasy and i dont plan on returning to that salon again

weve been singing the praises of dr pendleton ever since we made the switch from healing hearts pediatrics our daughter was younger at the time and we were looking for a more personalized approach to her care weve been patients of dr pendletons for over five years now and weve never had any issues getting an appointment when we need one danielle and dr pendleton have been absolute stars when it comes to interacting with our kids

if colourful zany standoutfromthecrowd shoes are your thing then theres no better place to go than helen bateman the shoes here are all individual and unique so you definitely wont find them anywhere else in the world and they certainly arent copies of other brands like many shoe companies these bad boys march to the beat of their own drumnni love heels but im a little bit more conservative with shoes going mainly for single colours and printed pumps are usually as adventurous as i go so helen bateman shoes really are for those who like to make a statement with their shoesnnthey are all made with excellent quality materials and when i had a browse round the shop on william street i could see how good quality the shoes were they have everything from boots pumps and trainers to heels and wedges  all of which make a statementnnif youre looking for something a little bit different then give this place a try

after a disappointing encounter with another cleaning company i turned to noble cleaners for my carpet and tile cleaning needs the two brothers who run the business were a pleasure to work with and their dedication to their work was evident in the quality of the service they provided they were also very reasonable in their pricing and accepting credit cards with no extra charge im happy to have supported a local business and i would definitely use them again

on tuesday i went to a bar with a friend looking forward to a quick drink unfortunately the service was slow and the drinks were disappointing i ordered a long island iced tea but the bartenders seemed unfamiliar with the recipe and had to look it up online even then they failed to include some essential ingredients resulting in an unpleasant drink the waitress was slow to take our payment and seemed more interested in socializing with her friends than attending to our needs which made for a frustrating experience overall

whenever im in the area i find myself returning to this eatery even though the sushi is nothing special and the cost is a bit high the atmosphere doesnt exactly exude refinement but there must be something else that keeps me coming back

i was having a great time getting my pedicure until the technician accidentally cut one of my cuticles causing me to yelp in pain despite my discomfort the technician kept pulling on it leading to bleeding and intense pain he offered a hasty apology and moved on to the next nail but the polish job was marred by the traumatic experience my little toe took weeks to heal and im not planning on returning to that salon anytime soon

our second visit to the smaller theatre the actors cafe  we saw the mousetrap last year and biloxi blues tonight  although we had seen the mousetrap before in london its been almost 40 years and it was time for a review  enjoyed the production in 2013  tonight neither of us had ever seen a production of neil simons autobigraphical second part of the three part triology bookended by brighton beach memoirs and broadway bound  the cast was delightful and it was interesting to note that a couple of the actors had just recently finished high school sorry but it showed and they are gaining valuable experience  the lead actor who played eugene who also narrated directly to the audience was delightful and quite a talent as well as the actor who played the sergeant although it was scary to be this close to him in this small space  the theatre is very small seating maybe 80 people at best and seating is flexible or festival seating as i like to call it but i ordered the tickets online 600 fee and printed out my actual tickets with bar codes on them to present at the door  however the doorman asked if i had stopped at the box office on the way in and when i told him no he asked for our names so he could tell them  unclear that we were expected to report to the box office since it appeared that the tickets printed were actual replicas of tickets with bar codes  it was not clearly explained on the web site that we were expected to report to the box office and we were not clear on the festival seating either or we would have arrived earlier so we didnt have to get stuck on the front row with our knees touching the edge of the stage  but the shows have been delightful so one star off for getting the website together and see you again next summer

weve been thrilled with the level of care weve received from dr pendleton we decided to switch to her office from healing hearts pediatrics when our daughter was still young and its been a fantastic decision weve been patients for over five years now and weve never had any

i visited the former olympic gyros location on 24th street for lunch today and had a mixed experience while the restaurant itself is small the 499 gyro i ordered was flavorful and had plenty of meat however i was disappointed that they were unable to provide a cup of water to accompany my meal

the servers overthetop italian drawl the mediocre free house wine the unimpressive minestrone soup the garlic bread that was heavy on butter and light on garlic and the unremarkable fettuccini alfredo all fell short of my expectations despite the generous portion size for 2795 i expected more than just a decent amount of chargrilled chicken breast slices

as an aficionado of spanish cuisine i came in hoping to be at the least semiblown but resulted in a half satisfied appetite  the biggest draw for me was the seemingly endless count of tapas at least a dozen in each category seafood meat vegetablescheese  i always get a kick from trying to visualize what fun flavors can be produced from these exotic ingredientsnnin my humble book i tend to base my spanish experience on one dish and one dish only and that is the glorious paella  for me this is a deal breaker  the pricing was fair and reasonable but the quality fell quite short the classic valencia was simply too watery history tells me it should be fluffier creamier and rich in flavor on the other hand the arros negre was more pleasing and entertaining if you never had squid ink in the paella form it is a safe try  the only caveat is it temporarily leaves black marks around your lips teeth and tonguennthe list of tapas we tried included n the best and recommendednn the spanish potato pie was not as soft and fluffy as i imagined parts of it were choppy mediocre tastenn mushrooms with garlic and sherry very average nothing too special herenn rabbit stew with bread sauce for the first time trying this it was actually pretty good tasted like chicken  the meat was tender with a rich flavored stewnn braised oxtail in paprika sauce pleasantly pulled off the bone goodnn lamb chops thought it was somewhat dry thus not as juicy as i had hoped for  2 or 3 pieces i believenn calamari rings the batter was light and cooked perfectly accompanied by three different sauces that i cannot recall the names to but nonetheless tastynn snails average nothing to spectacularnnthe pitcher of sangria was too small for my usual liking it filled just 4 small glasses and lacked the wine tastennwhat i liked the most was the atmospherelive music created a fun mood and the rich detail of the spanishesque decor to bring everything togethernnsince i was here for my birthday they did bring out a complimentary flan that i thought tasted a little eggy the cool part was partaking in a spanish tradition where the server shoots a long stream of wine into your mouth n noverall the experience here was just average with mediocre flavors among the tapas with some exceptions thus i would only return for the squid ink paella rabbit stew and braised oxtail

after eagerly anticipating the opening of noodles  co i was thrilled to finally try it out with a friend we arrived just after 1230 pm and the line was nearly out the door which wasnt surprising given that it was a new restaurant however after enjoying my meal and overhearing the comments of the diners around me i can see this place having a steady 20person line from 1130 am to 130 pm the interior is smartly designed open and bright and the staff was incredibly friendly and seemed to be in a great mood eager to share their positivity with customers i opted for the pick3 deal which includes a small noodle bowl a choice of protein and soup or salad for 799 i chose the indonesian noodle dish with spicy peanut sauce which was really awesome and perfectly spicy packed with fresh vegetables i added beef and the tomato basil soup which was my favorite part of the meal by the time i added a drink my bill came to just under 10 im excited to return and try some of their other options such as the meat

if youre in the market for shoes that truly stand out from the crowd helen bateman is the place to go their collection features a wide variety of styles from boots and pumps to trainers and wedges all of which are crafted with highquality materials what sets them apart is their individuality â€“ you wont find these designs anywhere else in the world while some may prefer more subdued footwear helen batemans shoes are perfect for those who want to make a bold statement with their footwear

as a fervent fan of spanish cuisine i had high hopes for a fulfilling dining experience but unfortunately my expectations were only partially met the restaurants extensive selection of tapas with at least a dozen options in each category was undoubtedly its strongest selling point however the quality of the dishes fell short of my expectations with the exception of the arros negre which was flavorful and entertaining the paella in particular was a disappointment lacking the richness and creaminess that i had anticipated the pricing was reasonable but the overall experience was merely average with some dishes impressing me more than others

if youre looking for shoes that really stand out from the crowd helen bateman is the place to go their shoes are all oneofakind and you wont find them anywhere else in the world theyre not like other brands that copy each others designs these shoes are truly unique and make a bold statement however if youre like me and prefer a more understated look they also have singlecolored pumps and printed pumps that are a bit more tame the quality of the shoes is topnotch and when i visited their shop on william street i could see how wellmade they were they have a wide range of styles to choose from including boots pumps trainers and wedges all of which are sure to turn heads

i was searching for a reliable and affordable cleaning service and im so glad i found noble cleaners the two brothers who own and operate the company were professional friendly and thorough in their work they took the time to address all my questions and concerns and their equipment was topnotch im thrilled to have supported a local business and i highly recommend noble cleaners to anyone looking for a trustworthy cleaning service

i decided to grab lunch at the 24th street spot that used to be olympic gyros the restaurant may not be large but the 499 gyro i ordered was certainly satisfying however i was surprised that they were unable to offer a cup of water to go with my meal which was a bit of a letdown

this restaurant offers an impressive array of seafood and the price is incredibly reasonable for a mere 20 per person you can sample a variety of dishes including sushi sashimi mussels and crab legs the selection is vast and the quality is consistently high however be aware that arriving late may limit your options and some items may not be as fresh additionally the crab legs are highly popular so act quickly to secure your share while the sushi is delicious

although our service was slow the charming atmosphere of this outdoor breakfast spot still deserves a fivestar rating we were a group of two adults and four children all ordering from the adult menu but our waitress took her time delivering our food and we had to remind her twice about a forgotten item after the meal we waited patiently for our check but it took a while to arrive and when it did we were told that the restaurant was experiencing computer issues which caused another delay despite the inconvenience i would still like to return to this quaint spot without the kids to try out their lunch and dinner options as everything was served separately and we enjoyed watching a morning wedding and the farmers picking beautiful flowers while we ate
i stopped by a bar on tuesday with a friend hoping for a quick and enjoyable drink unfortunately

dr pendleton has won our hearts over with her exceptional care and dedication we switched to her office from healing hearts pediatrics when our daughter was still young and we couldnt be happier with the decision weve been loyal patients for over five years now and weve always found it easy to secure an appointment when needed danielle and dr pendleton have been absolute gems in terms of their bedside manner with our kids
a costly mistake for mexican food lovers
best food i ate during my 5 day stay in vegas by far

what an absolutely lovely spot for breakfast al fresco the ambience itself would have gotten five stars however our service was incredibly slow  we were a table of two adults and four children  all ordering from the adult menu  our waitress was quick to take our order but the food took exceptionally long and we had to ask twice for something that had been forgotten  after the meal we waited a bit to get our check but sent her back immediately with a credit card  after about five minutes we were told they were experiencing computer issues so it would be another moment or two  had she been up front about the delay wed have been more understanding but having to track her down on more than one occasion was a little bit of an annoyance  id like to go back sans kids to try out both the lunch and dinner restaurants  i love that everything was separate and we enjoyed watching both a morning wedding and the farmers picking beautiful flowers while we ate  such a quaint spot and didnt feel at all like we were in the middle of the desert

this picturesque outdoor breakfast spot has a charming ambiance that deserves a fivestar rating but our service was regrettably slow our party of two adults and four children ordered from the adult menu but our waitress took her time delivering our food and we had to remind her twice about a forgotten item after the meal we waited patiently for our check but it took a while to arrive and when it did we were told that the restaurant was experiencing computer issues which caused another delay despite the inconvenience i would still like to return to this quaint spot without the kids to try out their lunch and dinner options as everything

i called noble cleaners may i mention two local brothers who bust their hump as owners and employees after i was treated terribly by carpet green clean  i learned the carpet industry has a bait and switch tactic basically i wanted my entire house done the carpet tile and sofa just get it done in one big swoop the other company showed up and doubled their original price after haggling it went down a few hundred but i was so turned off i called noble cleaners while the guy was in my living room n  originally noble was my second lowest on the price check but after getting a proposed bill of 1k noble became seriously cheap the brothers came out the next day and on time they looked professional and had great equipment see the day before a single guy arrived in a beat up van with one machine for the entire project same machine for my micro fiber couch and carpet and said it would take the same amount of time that these two men would take i was getting had prob cause im a girln   noble did amazing work for a great price they kept with the price they quoted over the phone answered all my questions let me stand over their shoulders as i watched all the gross filth go through the nozzle also i didnt feel weird having these strange men in my house they are the sweetest thing ever in fact when i was making my first round of calls they said if i had any questions even if i dont choose them call back to be sure im not getting swindled n   they accept credit cards for no extra charge just fyi also i just felt good helping a local mom and pop company whose work you know will rock because the two own the company i recommend this company with my whole heart and will use them again save yourself the time patience and energy just give them a call
while sin city offered plenty of tasty options during my fiveday visit one particular meal blew me away as the absolute best food i enjoyed
this is without a doubt one of the

im bewildered by the positive reviews for this eatery ive been there three times now and while the ambiance and decor are nice the food has been subpar the chicken chimichanga and veggie burrito i ordered were only lukewarm and the flavors were uninspired the rice and beans were particularly bland and i prefer authentic mexican cuisine not something that tastes like taco bell in fact id give taco bell 3 stars because its fast food and i know what to expect unfortunately this restaurant didnt meet my expectations and we even had to buy our own chips and salsa which is typically complimentary at mexican restaurants

noodles co had a grand opening and i was eager to taste their food i went there with a friend and we arrived at 1230 pm the line was out the door but it was a new restaurant so it was expected the atmosphere was open and bright and the staff was friendly and enthusiastic i ordered the indonesian noodle dish with spicy peanut sauce and added beef and it was perfect the tomato basil soup was my favorite and my total bill was under 10 im looking forward to trying their other options like the meatball sub

my wife and i dropped by villa dolce for a drink and were surprised to learn that they had been in business for seven years we initially sat at the cozy bar but the bright string lights made it difficult to see so we moved to seats by the window when we mentioned our concern to the bartender she didnt seem to understand our feedback despite this we enjoyed our drinks including a negroni the size of a small pool and a mixed berry gin lemonade with fresh blueberries and raspberries the pizzas

i visited the former olympic gyros location on 24th street for lunch today and had a mixed experience while the restaurant itself is small the 499 gyro i ordered was flavorful and had plenty of meat however i was surprised that they were unable to provide a cup of water to accompany my meal which was a bit of a letdown

as a passionate devotee of spanish cuisine i had high hopes for a satisfying dining experience but unfortunately my expectations were only partially met the restaurants extensive selection of tapas with at least a dozen options in each category was undoubtedly its strongest selling point however the quality of the dishes fell short of my expectations with the exception of the arros negre which was flavorful and entertaining the paella in particular was a disappointment lacking the richness and creaminess that i had anticipated the pricing was reasonable but the overall experience was merely average with some dishes impressing me more than others
i continue to eat here when im visiting campus and i dont know why the sushi is okay at best and overpriced the atmosphere is tacky

the food at this restaurant falls short of expectations despite its appealing decor making it a letdown for those seeking a satisfying mexican dining experience its high prices only add to the disappointment unfortunately it fails to meet the standards of a genuine mexican food establishment in phoenix

i had mixed feelings about the consignment store while the consigned furniture was unique and reasonably priced it made up a large portion of the inventory which was unusual the rest of the furniture was overpriced and could be found at other stores on spring mountain im unsure if ill return

a pricey disappointment for those seeking authentic mexican cuisine

my fiveday vegas adventure featured some delicious eats but one dining experience truly stole the show as the best food i had

im puzzled by the positive reviews for this restaurant ive visited three times now and while the atmosphere and decor are pleasant the food has been subpar i ordered the chicken chimichanga and my wife had the veggie burrito unfortunately the temperature of the food was only warm not hot and the flavors were uninspired the rice and beans were particularly bland i prefer authentic mexican cuisine not something that tastes like taco bell in fact id give taco bell 3 stars because its fast food and i know what to expect unfortunately this restaurant didnt meet my expectations and we even had to buy our own chips and salsa which is something thats typically complimentary at mexican restaurants

im frustrated with the customer service i received from findlay vw i bought a brand new 2011 vw jetta from them last november and shortly after i had a tire blowout the dealership was unhelpful in resolving the issue and the salesperson i worked with didnt return my calls it took a lot of effort but they eventually agreed to split the cost of the tire with me now im having another problem

during our second visit to the smaller theatre we had the opportunity to enjoy two productions the mousetrap and biloxi blues while we had previously seen the mousetrap in london almost 40 years ago it was due for a review we found the production in 2013 to be enjoyable and as for biloxi blues neither of us had seen a production of neil simons autobiographical second part of the threepart trilogy which is bookended by brighton beach memoirs and broadway bound the cast delivered a delightful performance and it was interesting to note that a couple of the actors had recently finished high school although they are gaining valuable experience their inexperience showed

the breakfast we were served was unexpectedly delicious with biscuits that possibly rank among the best ive ever had my friends blueberry pancakes were fresh and bursting with flavor while my omelette made with country sausage was fluffy and yellow just as eggs should be despite some concerns about the wait time based on other yelp reviews we were able to enjoy our meal within 15 minutes of arriving if youre looking for a lovely breakfast spot in south mountain that feels like a charming farm in the midwest this is a great option for a weekend morning with loved ones

the servers overthetop italian accent the mediocre free house wine the unimpressive minestrone soup the garlic bread that was heavy on butter and light on garlic and the unremarkable fettuccini alfredo all fell short of my expectations despite the generous portion size

the menu at this restaurant doesnt mirror aristocrat restaurants offerings in manila with a focus on grilled dishes appetizers and noodles their chicken bbq didnt quite meet my expectations but their java rice was a nice surprise despite some initial disorganization id still recommend visiting due to their affordable prices and convenient location next to lbc and jolibee

helen bateman is the ultimate destination for anyone seeking unique and eyecatching shoes their oneofakind designs are unlike anything youll find elsewhere and their commitment to quality materials ensures that each shoe is both stylish and durable whether youre looking for boots pumps trainers or wedges helen bateman has something for everyone their shop on william street is a mustvisit for anyone who wants to elevate their shoe game and make a statement with their footwear
im confused by the high ratings for this restaurant ive visited three times now

cox is atrociousnnbefore moving to phoenix we had directv because of the direction our apartment faces the dish could not be installed so we went with cox once our introductory period was up our service became really crappy the hd channels that we pay extra for are fuzzy  jumpy a technician came out a couple of weeks ago and made some repairs and adjustments everything was working fine for about a week and slowly the fuzziness  jumpiness returned in first the hd channels now all the channels are crappy i just finished chatting online with a rep i cant bare to talk to someone on the phone i would curse someone out another technician is coming back on friday this time i requested they replace the digital box oh and we cant access ondemand programming either nnwe havent had any problem with our internet thats why they get 1 star once our contract is up which i hope is soon we are cancelling

ive been unhappy with my hair growth after chemotherapy but calvin at this salon did a fantastic job with my haircut he took the time to understand my concerns and gave me a haircut that exceeded my expectations i highly recommend him and will be going back in 46 weeks for my next trim

i stopped by the 24th street location that used to house olympic gyros for lunch today the eatery may be tiny but their 499 gyro certainly doesnt skimp on the meat unfortunately they seemed to have difficulty providing a simple cup of water to complement my meal

as i was enjoying my pedicure the technician inadvertently cut too close to one of my cuticles causing me to exclaim in pain the cuticle started bleeding and the technician continued to pull on it making the pain worse he apologized quickly and moved on to the next nail but the damage was already done the polish job may have looked fine but the experience left a sour taste in my mouth i wont be going back to that salon again

i visited a bar on tuesday with a friend eager to enjoy a refreshing drink unfortunately the experience was disappointing as the service was slow and the drinks were subpar i ordered a long island iced tea a common cocktail but the bartenders had to search for the recipe online and even then they missed some key ingredients despite this they still served the drink which was awful the waitress was slow to take our payment and seemed more interested in chatting with her friends than attending to our needs

when my friend and i came in on a monday night we were worried that the restaurant was empty but our waiter earnest was super friendly and didnt hover over us or try to make small talk which was great the food was also amazing with the crab rangoon and kalbi being highlights the menu was a bit confusing but the quality of the food made up for it i definitely recommend this place especially during the week when they could use more business

i was looking for a reliable and affordable cleaning service and noble cleaners exceeded my expectations the two brothers who own the company were professional friendly and thorough in their work they took the time to address all my questions and concerns and their equipment was topnotch im so glad i chose to support a local business and i highly recommend noble cleaners for anyone looking

i would not reccommend this dealership to anyone i purchased a brand new 2011 vw jetta last november from findlay vw 2 weeks after i purchased the car the tire blew out and no one could figure out what the cause was at first they were going to make me pay full prices for the tire even though i only had the car barely 2 weeks after arguing with them and going back and forth they finally split the cost with me the sales person i purchased it from during the whole ordeal would not call me back after leaving several messages now i have something else wrong with it i will never take my car back there for anything i go to desert where they have much better customer service the customer service at findlay volkswagen is horrible after they got their money and my trade in they didnt care about me afterwards i would never recommend them to anyone or go back to them for anything maybe theres a reason why my car was the last 2011 on the lot and they just wanted to get rid of it

the fake italian drawl from the server the crappy free house wine the mushy lukewarm minestrone soup nnthe garlic bread that was more buttered than garlicnnthe fettuccini alfredo was creamy but bland the tastiest thing was the char grilled chicken breast slices it was a decent amountnnhowever for 2795 im underwhelmed lol oh well
underwhelming experience with too much repetition
the food at this place is just okay

my spouse and i recently visited villa dolce for a beverage and we were unaware that the establishment had been open for seven years we initially sat at the bar but the bright string lights made it difficult to see so we moved to seats by the window although we mentioned our concern to the bartender she didnt seem to comprehend our feedback despite this we enjoyed our drinks including a negroni the size of a small pool and a mixed berry gin lemonade with fresh blueberries and raspberries the pizzas salads and desserts being served looked delicious making us wonder why we hadnt tried making them at home

this spot is handsdown one of the top places to catch a concert in vegas the cosmo pool is a close second but this place takes the cake my husband and i practically live at the beach during the summer because they offer an amazing variety of concerts in a laidback and fun atmosphere its the perfect escape from the chaos of the strip weve seen some amazing performances from ziggy marley to one republic just be prepared for expensive drinks and long bar lines so its a good idea to grab some drinks beforehand

i went in tuesday for a quick drink with a friend and was thoroughly disappointed  i ordered a long island ice tea which is a pretty standard drink but the two young ladies working had to look it up online okay fine but they were missing a few key ingredients  but served it anyway and it was awful instead of serving a subpar drink offer something else service was slow too when we were ready to pay and leave the waitress was off sitting and talking with some friends

our family has been thrilled with the level of care weve received from dr pendleton we decided to switch to her office from healing hearts pediatrics when our daughter was still a toddler and its been a fantastic decision

you go into four peaks and everybody there is your friend on a busy friday night this is the weekend warmup to beat them all its loud its packed its fun nnill usually mix up brews but i always come back to my old friend kilt lifter appropriately named i would say  goes great with just about anything but i enjoy the spinach artichoke dip shrimp  goat cheese bruschetta and their calamari is the best ive tried anywhere definitely worth stopping in

i love the haircut i got at this salon calvin did a fantastic job with my hair as i have been unhappy with the way it was growing after chemo calvin took the time to discuss what i wanted without rushing and seem to know exactly what i wanted would recommend highly and will be going back in 46 wks to have trim

the food is alright  its kind of overpriced and the quality sucks  ive been here once before i dont know why i came back  yes i do  a friend mozied on in and the group just followedni got the breakfast burritos  the portion size was so tiny a major disappointment on my end  beans sucked pinto beans always sucks  i forgot the other side that came with it i thnk it was friesi love fries except sweet potato  those should be banned from restaurants unless theyre not in the form of fries

during a recent outing with some friends we stumbled upon this incredible eatery that immediately captured our hearts with its vibrant atmosphere and delicious food we shared a few tapas dishes and enjoyed some cocktails and everything was absolutely scrumptious while the price tag was a bit steep i hadnt had a kalimotxo in a long time so i decided to treat myself im really looking forward to going back and hope this restaurant sticks around because there arent many places like it in the area
a beautifully decorated restaurant with a menu that falls short

i had a terrible experience with carpet green clean so i decided to try noble cleaners instead the two brothers who own and work at the company were professional punctual and provided great service at an affordable price they answered all my questions and made sure i was comfortable with the work they were doing im so glad i chose to support a local business and i highly recommend them

upon entering the restaurant on a monday evening my friend and i were worried by the empty atmosphere however our waiter earnest quickly put our minds at ease with his friendly and efficient service the food was also impressive with the crab rangoon and kalbi being particular highlights while the menu was a bit confusing the quality of the food made up for it i would definitely recommend this restaurant to others especially during the week when it seems they could use more business

after a disappointing experience with another cleaning company i turned to noble cleaners for my carpet and tile cleaning needs the two brothers who run the business were a pleasure to work with and their dedication to their work was evident in the quality of the service they provided they were also very reasonable in their pricing and accepting credit cards with no extra charge im happy to have supported a local business and i would definitely use them again

during our second visit to the smaller theatre we had the pleasure of enjoying two productions the mousetrap and biloxi blues while we had previously seen the mousetrap in london almost 40 years ago it was due for a review we found the production in 2013 to be enjoyable as for biloxi blues neither of us had seen a production of neil simons autobiographical second part of the threepart trilogy which is bookended by brighton beach memoirs and broadway bound the cast delivered a delightful performance and it was interesting to note that a couple of the actors had recently finished high school although they are gaining valuable experience their inexperience showed the lead actor who played eugene and narrated directly to the audience was delightful and quite talented similarly the actor who played the sergeant was impressive although it was unsettling to be seated so close to him in the small theatre with a seating capacity of approximately 80 people the theatre is quite intimate and the flexible seating arrangement which i like to call festival seating allowed us to choose our seats however

as a lover of lingerie im always on the lookout for unique and highquality pieces while love jones may be a bit pricey their selection is truly exceptional and their window displays are absolutely droolworthy changing hourly their beach bunny bathing suits are a personal favorite of mine as theyre essentially lingerie for the daytime and let me tell you the gold star pasties were a huge hit at my girlfriends birthday party if youre looking to treat yourself or your significant other love jones is definitely worth a visit

i had a disappointing experience with findlay vw i purchased a brand new 2011 vw jetta from them last november and just two weeks later i had a blown tire the dealership was unhelpful in resolving the issue and the salesperson i worked with didnt return my calls after a lot of back and forth they finally agreed to split the cost of the tire with me now im having another problem with the car and i wont be taking it back to findlay vw for any reason instead ill go to desert volkswagen where the customer service is much better overall my experience with findlay vw was horrible and i wouldnt recommend them to anyone

im so happy with my new haircut from this salon calvin did a fantastic job especially considering ive been unhappy with my hairs growth after chemotherapy he took the time to understand my concerns and gave me a haircut that exceeded my expectations i highly recommend calvin and will be going back in 46 weeks for my next trim

the food here is just okay and the prices are a bit steep ive been here once before and im not sure why i came back maybe it was because a friend suggested it i ordered the breakfast burritos which were small and not that great the beans were a letdown especially the pinto beans i cant remember what the other side dish was but i think it was fries i enjoy fries but sweet potato fries are not my favorite they should only be served in restaurants if theyre not in the form of fries
among the many mouthwatering options i tried during my five days in las vegas one meal truly stood out as the best leaving a lasting impression on my taste buds

as a spanish cuisine enthusiast i was eager to indulge in a variety of tapas at this restaurant while the selection was indeed impressive with numerous options in each category the quality of the dishes was inconsistent the paella which i hold in high regard was sadly lacking in both flavor and texture on the other hand the arros negre was a pleasant surprise with its bold flavors and entertaining presentation the pricing was fair but my overall satisfaction with the meal was only moderate as some dishes fell short of

i stopped by the 24th street restaurant that previously housed olympic gyros for lunch today despite its small size the eaterys 499 gyro was satisfying and packed with meat however i was surprised that they were unable to provide a cup of water to complement my meal which was a bit of a letdown

the servers exaggerated italian accent the subpar free house wine the unimpressive minestrone soup the garlic bread that was heavy on butter and light on garlic and the unremarkable fettuccini alfredo all left me feeling underwh

the breakfast we were served exceeded our expectations with biscuits that were surprisingly delicious my friend had blueberry pancakes that were incredibly fresh and my omelette made with country sausage was cooked to perfection despite some concerns about the wait time we were seated and served quickly if youre in the area and looking for a charming breakfast spot that feels like a beautiful farm this is a great option for a weekend morning with family or friends
